intro: Porophyllum brevifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are narrow and often covered with fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Porophyllum brevifolium is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with low precipitation.
